question: If a didentate ligand ethane-1,2-diamine (en) is progressively added to $[Ni(H_2O)_6]^{2+}$ solution, complexes form with colors: Pale blue ($[Ni(H_2O)_4en]^{2+}$), Blue/purple ($[Ni(H_2O)_2(en)_2]^{2+}$), Violet ($[Ni(en)_3]^{2+}$). The wavelength in nm of light absorbed in case of I (Pale blue) and III (Violet) are respectively:
explanation: The ligand strength is $en > H_2O$. Replacing H2O with en increases crystal field splitting (Energy).
Energy $E \propto 1/\lambda$. Higher Energy absorbed means shorter Wavelength absorbed.
Complex III (strong field) absorbs higher energy (shorter wavelength) than Complex I (weak field).
Looking at options: (B) 600 > 535 fits this trend correctly. (Complementary colors: Absorbing Orange/Red (600) -> Blue appearance; Absorbing Green/Yellow (535) -> Violet appearance).
